statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Marquette 67, DePaul 57
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Steve Novak scored 22 points and Marquette dealt a blow to DePaul's hopes of winning Conference USA with a 67-57 victory over the Blue Demons on Sunday. Drake Diener scored 16 for DePaul (16-7, 8-4). The Blue Demons are two games behind Louisville and Charlotte with four games remaining. Travis Diener, the cousin of DePaul's Drake, scored 15 points for Marquette (18-8, 6-7), coming off a crushing 64-61 loss to Louisville. The Golden Eagles, who had lost six of nine, led for nearly the entire second half, but Drake Diener's 3-pointer brought the Blue Demons to within three at 54-51 with 6:11 left. Marquette then scored five consecutive points, opening a 59-51 lead with 3:25 to go on Todd Townsend's free throw. DePaul pulled within 61-55 on LeVar Seals' rebound basket with 1:49 left, but Quemont Greer missed two free throws on the Blue Demons' next possession. Overall, DePaul was just 3-of-9 from the stripe in the second half. Travis Diener made two free throws for Marquette, Seals missed a driving layup and Novak hit two free throws to give the Golden Eagles a 65-55 lead with 36 seconds to go. It was the final regular-season game between the Diener cousins of Fond du Lac. Travis and Marquette went 6-2 against Drake and DePaul. Marquette led 31-29 at halftime and scored nine consecutive points early in the second half to open a 40-31 lead on Joe Chapman's 3-pointer with 16:28 left. Greer finished with 13 points. Marquette forward Chris Grimm missed the game with a fracture in his left elbow, suffered Thursday night against Louisville. He is expected to miss two to three weeks.
